result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cody Adam Paul in court. Stated recited the request of the victim. Court questioned the victim. Questioned the defendant. Court amended the bond to no violent/abusive contact with CNG, not be at the residence. work place, or vehicle. 9:03 AM

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody Adam Paul appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail with Attorney Peter Middleton. Waived reading. Right to atty. $1,000.00 signature bond. Standard felony conditions. No contact by any means with C.N.G. or their residence, workplace or vehicle. Waived time limits.
